title: (Resolution) Act 2011 (No. 27 of 2011), having consulted with the Central Bank
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Credit Institutions Resolution
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Credit Institutions Resolution 

Fund Levy (Amendment) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited credit institution resolution fund levy (amendment) regulation 2022

title: (Resolution) Act 2011 (No. 27 of 2011), having consulted with the Central Bank
heading: 2. The Credit Institutions Resolution Fund Levy Regulations 2012 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
2. The Credit Institutions Resolution Fund Levy Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 
381 of 2012) (amended by the Credit Institutions Resolution Fund Levy 
(Amendment) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 481 of 2021)) are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 2 - 

(i) 

in paragraph (1), by the substitution of the following 
definition for the definition of “levy period”: 

“ ‘levy period’ means the period commencing on 1 October 
2022 and ending on 30 September 2023.”, and 

(ii) 

in paragraph (3), by the substitution of “30 June 2022” for 
“30 June 2021”, 

(b) 

(c) 

in Regulation 3(1), by the substitution of “1 October 2022” for “1 
October 2021”, 

in Regulation 4(1), by the substitution of “28 February 2023” for 
“28 

February 2022”, and 

(d) 

in Column (3) of the Schedule, opposite Reference Number 5, by 
the substitution of “0.024725 per cent” for “0.024914 per cent”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 September, 2022. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 27th September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [477] 3
